subtitle: Get ready to be a Mom!
description: Get ready to be a Mom!
title: Month 9
content:
Created by Baby Center

Your baby can be born any day now! Inside your womb he is shedding the fine
hair he grew in the middle of pregnancy. He is also losing the waxy coating on
his skin which protected him while he was floating in the fluid inside your
womb. Your baby is developing layers of fat under his skin, which will help
keep him warm when he is born. Newborn babies need to be kept warm. The best
way to do this is to hold him close to your chest inside your clothes. You may
wonder how you will know when labour starts. There are three ways that labour
may begin. 1\. You may notice a bloodstained discharge on your underwear. This
is a sign that labour may begin in the next day or two. 2\. You may have
contractions that feel like period pains. They get that stronger, regular and
more painful as labour progresses. 3\. You may have a gush or trickle of
water. If this happens you should go straight to the health facility. Make
sure you know how to get to the health facility before labour starts. You need
a midwife, nurse or doctor to care for you if you are in labour. Check that
you have credit on your phone and money for a bus or taxi.
